attributes.action: Pause UK vaccinations, once priority groups are done, to curb cases worldwide
attributes.additional_details: In addition to the logical argument that this will reduce our future problems with the virus, I believe this is a compassionate step to save lives worldwide. As we have been so successful in our vaccination program, we are approaching a moral question. Do we vaccinate those at relatively low risk in the UK and leave certain people abroad with no protection from the virus or choose a compassionate route and save lives world wide. I'd like to believe that as a nation we would show affinity to our fellow human beings.
attributes.background: In line with the World Health Organisation's advice, the UK government should aim to reduce the Covid-19 cases worldwide. By pausing vaccinations we can further contribute to the world vaccination effort. This will reduce the risk of new strains of the virus emerging.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/572802
